meanings.definition: The quality or state of being terrifying or horrifying.
meanings.sent1: The haunted house was filled with ghastliness, scaring all who dared to enter.
meanings.sent2: The movie's ghastliness left the audience trembling in fear.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled nervously at the fake ghastliness of the Halloween decorations.
meanings.sent4: The ghastliness of the storm clouds looming overhead made everyone seek shelter.
meanings.sent5: The ghastliness of the monster's appearance was etched into their memories forever.

meanings.definition: An instance of causing fear or horror.
meanings.sent1: The sudden scream in the dark alley sent a wave of ghastliness through her.
meanings.sent2: The ghastliness of the crime scene made even the seasoned detective shudder.
meanings.sent3: The prankster's attempt at creating ghastliness backfired when his friends burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The ghastliness of the situation was like a dark cloud hanging over their heads.
meanings.sent5: The ghastliness of the ghost's wail echoed through the old mansion, chilling all who heard it.
